intro: Cyclophorus warburgii, commonly known as the Warburg's cyclophorus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to certain regions of Africa and is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
